DOC.brief_title: Prophylactic Dextrose Gel Newborns High-risk Hypoglycemia
DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : Low blood sugar newborn affect 10 % delivery 50 % newborn identify risk factor associate poor long-term neurodevelopmental outcome . Risk factor transient neonatal hypoglycemia include infant diabetic mother , infant large small gestational age , infant intrauterine growth restriction , late-preterm infant . GAP : Current standard care recommend asymptomatic infant receive intravenous dextrose become hypoglycemic . International study use dextrose gel show buccal mucosa promise alternative route , normalizes hypoglycemia , decrease NICU admission . So far , study publish result efficacy prophylactic dextrose gel . HYPOTHESIS : We hypothesize prophylactic treatment newborn at-risk transient neonatal hypoglycemia 40 % dextrose gel raise blood sugar level 15 % compare untreated control . We hypothesize 40 % dextrose gel prevent 50 % NICU admission at-risk population compare matched control . METHODS : This quasi-experimental study . The study population include baby bear Harris Health Ben Taub Hospital risk factor transient neonatal hypoglycemia . After baby completes first fee , give dose oral dextrose gel . A blood sugar level check 30 minute , per standard care . One hundred at-risk infant identify write parental consent prior delivery receive prophylactic treatment . Five hundred additional matched control similar risk factor analyze comparison receive treatment . RESULTS : Pending IMPACT : If study prove hypothesis correct , prophylactic dextrose gel could implement newborn nursery around country prevent transient hypoglycemia , decrease NICU admission ( associated cost , painful procedure , separation family ) , improve feed quality , potentially optimize neurodevelopmental outcome .
